question_content.description:
### Problem07


To learn object-oriented programming(OOP), we need to review the
definition of datatype.

- A data type is a set of values and a set of _____(0)\___ defind on
  those values.

- An _____(1)\___ data type is data type whose representation is
  hidden from the client.

- In Java, each data-type value is stored in an _____(2)\___.

_Excerpt From
Computer Science
Sedgewick, Robert,Wayne, Kevin
